remarks: If two structures have the same group components (properties), one is an Abelian group iff the other one is.  (Contributed by NM, 6-Dec-2014.)
statement:
ablpropd.1 $e |- ( ph -> B = ( Base ` K ) ) $.
ablpropd.2 $e |- ( ph -> B = ( Base ` L ) ) $.
ablpropd.3 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. B /\ y e. B ) ) -> ( x ( +g ` K ) y ) = ( x ( +g ` L ) y ) ) $.
ablpropd $p |- ( ph -> ( K e. Abel <-> L e. Abel ) ) $.
$d B x y $.
$d K x y $.
$d L x y $.
$d ph x y $.
